attributes.action: Require all car manufactures to offer retrofitting of L.E.D DRL
attributes.background:
I acknowledge that it is now a legal requirement for new cars to be fitted with DRL, however older vehicles can be retrofitted with them as they have a lot of benefits.
The point of the petition is to make it a legal requirement for all car manufactures to offer retrofitting LED DRL's
attributes.additional_details:
In the research conducted by the European Commision in 2006 it has been confirmed that they have potential in reducing road deaths due to making the vehicle more visible to other road users during the day and are then switched off when sidelights/dipped lights are switched on. 

Third party retrofitting systems are available but are not very reliable, hence why I wish all car manufactures to offer LED DRL's that would be installed by the manufacturer themselves.

attributes.action: Make the UK higher education system work like the US education system
attributes.background: In the first two years of study, in the American higher education system, you will generally be required to take a wide variety of classes in different subjects. I feel this is better than picking what you want to study ahead of going to university because you get a more rounded education.
attributes.additional_details:
One criticism of the American system is that teaching is more superficial than in UK higher education. I would argue, however, that students will gain a more rounded education this way. 

My reference for the way the HE system works in America is: https://www.studyusa.com/en/a/58/understanding-the-american-education-system

My reference for the American system being more superficial is: https://www.theguardian.com/higher-education-network/blog/2014/jun/30/uk-universities-better-education-dont-be-seduced-by-us

attributes.action: Free prescription charges in England
attributes.background:
Why should people in England be charged for prescriptions?
Why can the rest of the "United Kingdom" be exempt the same as Wales Scotland, Northern Ireland.
This is direct discrimination against anyone living in England.

attributes.action: Abolish prohibited lanes for HGV overtaking on M11 and A14.
attributes.background: These stretches of the M11 and A14 where overtaking for HGV’s is prohibited are completely counter productive. They serve to prevent HGV’s overtaking for long periods and inconveniencing other road users.
attributes.additional_details: In reality these lanes create long tailbacks as faster/unladen HGV’s have to queue behind other slower/laden vehicles uphill with reduced speeds of sometimes 25-30mph. When the restriction ends all the faster HGV’s accerlerate pull out into lane 2 to overtake. These lanes are a complete false economy and are dangerous.

attributes.action: Legally require the Net Internal Floor area to be quoted for every home on sale.
attributes.background: Homes in Britain are traded in terms of rooms rather than floor space. This lack of clear information is a source of market failure. British homes are getting more cramped and less fit for purpose.
attributes.additional_details: There are no minimum space standards for new housing in Britain. Research by CABE and LABC Warranty shows that developers are making homes smaller and smaller. New homes lack space for family meals, for childrens play and homework, and for storage. Quoting the Net Internal Floor area (e.g. as defined by the Valuation Office Agency) would help buyers understand exactly what they are getting, make objective comparisons, and identify value for money.

attributes.action: Cancel HS2 and use the allocated funds to help find a cure for cancer.
attributes.background: The debate on the long term benefits of HS2 and the use of an estimated £56bn of public funds on such a project have been going on for sometime. If the British public actually had a vote, would it be in favour of spending £56bn on HS2 or helping find a cure for cancer !
attributes.additional_details:
My mother has been battling with cancer for the last few years with the aid of vital treatments however a cure still doesn't exist and sadly  she has now been given months if not weeks to live as she is no longer responding to treatment.

A close family friend who stands to lose everything he's worked for much like countless others due to the HS2 project made a point that perhaps the funds could be better spent on something that could truly benefit each and everyone for generation to come.

attributes.action: Fund “Off The Street, Less Heat” youth project and similar projects
attributes.background: Off the Street, Less Heat is a youth diversion project which provides sports and other workshops to distract young people from anti-social behaviour, gang-related violence and street crime. Due to Government cuts, it and projects like it have lost funding.
attributes.additional_details: Off the Street, Less Heat was started in 2006/07 by Elaine Roberts, who came up with the name and idea, to help get young people off the streets and welcome people from all different communities. The project also aims to improve the relations between the police and the local community. Off the Street, Less Heat and similar projects all over the country need direct funding from the Government to ensure that they can continue.

attributes.action: Add 1p Income Tax & Reduce Aid to OECD average to create a BREXIT readiness fund
attributes.background: I believe the majority of British People support Foreign Aid spending but feel we are spending a bit too much currently. I also believe our Country is in need of Strategic Infrastructure and Business Support Spending to help us during the pre Brexit and immediate post Brexit period.

attributes.action: Require all schools to allow boys to wear shorts.
attributes.background: Most schools no longer give boys the option to wear shorts except when taking part in physical education however all schools allow girls to wear skirts. This is sexist and should be resolved by requiring schools to allow boys to wear shorts.

attributes.action: Make 30th November a national holiday in memory of Sir Winston Churchill
attributes.background: Sir Winston Leonard Spencer-Churchill, was a great national hero. A man who epitomized the British spirit during one of our nation's darkest times. In honour of this man, his birthday each year should be made a national holiday to commemorate him.

attributes.action: Teach about Babylonian history in schools!
attributes.background: The babylionan civilasation contributed immensly in shaping the worlds history. They contributed to one of the earliest forms of writting, the first ever laws through the code of Hammurabi, science and astrology and maths. This should be taught in schools.

attributes.action: If you are an English citizen, you should not have to pay to attend university.
attributes.background: In Scotland, you do not have to pay to attend university, however, English citizens have to pay extortionate amounts just to get education. Without this education, many young people will not get the chances that their futures' deserve. You can change all this with just a vote.

attributes.action: Bring back nit nurse to UK schools send them home till treated and clear 2018
attributes.background:
Sick of nits £££ on products such as treatments and repellents.
Hours spent combing through hair.
Laundry through constant washing.
Kids crying you pulling and tugging to the point you want to shave their head.
attributes.additional_details:
Abroad they still have nit nurses that come to check children’s heads in school regularly, once head lice are found the child is sent home and not allowed to return till rechecked and cleared.
I lived abroad and this works 100%.
Eliminates before it can even start to spread.
Desperate mum of a girl with beautiful long hair that seriously can’t take this anymore.

attributes.action: Introduce LGBT+ education to the primary curriculum in schools
attributes.background:
One of the reasons homophobia is still widespread is due to lack of education and understanding. To reverse this, and create a more accepting and less hating society for the future I want to petition for children to be educated.
Just as racism, sexism and other issues ARE issues, this is a HUGE one
attributes.additional_details:
Homophobia - the act of hatred from minor to extreme levels towards people who prefer the same gender
Impacts -
more hate crimes, tragedies, killings and more, just for something someone cant change and which is not abnormal, a "sin" or any other sort
Evidence -
You dont need me to state. Recall some memories when you were a child.Look at the messed up world.Look at the different LGBT rights in areas. Not many places have equal rights yet at ALL.
Speak up and SIGN this petition for EQUALITY

attributes.action: Regulate supported housing and hostels.
attributes.background: We need a regulatory body to license and oversee hostels and supported housing, including checking that support workers are trained, checking that licence agreements are fair, and offering a fair and impartial complaints procedure. Currently, owners get away with treating vulnerable adults unfairly.
attributes.additional_details: Vulnerable people can find it difficult to understand their rights and make complaints. Proper regulation would mean that vulnerable people would be protected without having to fight to be treated fairly. I have been discriminated against and there was nothing I could do about it. A housing charity evicted me for not engaging enough, even though I have a severe anxiety disorder and another didn't deal with a complaint fairly and wasn't impartial.

attributes.action: Do not make any changes to the current devolution arrangements
attributes.background: In 1997, the people of Scotland voted very decisively to have a devolved Scottish Parliament and devolved powers as well, and they are within an EU framework. But now, the UK government is planning a ‘power grab’ on these areas such as agriculture, farming and fishing.
attributes.additional_details: So I call on the UK government not to change the current devolution settlement. They say it will be more expensive to have different sets of rules, but I don’t agree with them. If they want a UK-wide framework, then maybe they could look towards having a federalised framework rather than a ‘power grab’.

attributes.action: Raise awareness of Mental illness in the South Asian and Islamic communities
attributes.background: We would like the government to intervene and educate community leaders, to prevent further stigma and abuse received by South Asians and particularly muslims who suffer from mental health issues, which results in mental health abuse, due to lack of intelligence in the subject by those in authority.

attributes.action: Make nonconsensual medical intervention for intersexed people illegal.
attributes.background: Data from intersex civil societies show that intersex nonconsensual surgeries are not a thing of the past. They expressed concern at unnecessary surgeries on intersex children before they can provide consent. It called on the government to stop these. This has not happened.
attributes.additional_details: About 1 in 2000 children are born with genitalia considered atypical enough to prompt medical investigation. Nonconsensual treatment, according to studies, often causes severe physical and psychological harm to patients. We need to stop nonconsensual medical interventions, as the Maltan government did, and make sure that no one has to suffer nonconsensual treatment again. Being intersex is not a bad thing. Intersex people deserve to be protected from discrimination.

attributes.action: Introduce new regulations for the development of Artificial Intelligence.
attributes.background: Artificial Intelligence is intelligent behaviour, exhibited by computers. Currently AI is at a primitive stage, home assistants are starting to play a role in our lives, but what they can do for us is limited. I want to see new regulations, for further development of AI and Machine Learning.
attributes.additional_details:
Many experts, including founder of Microsoft, Bill Gates, and Professor Stephen Hawking, have raised concerns over the development of AI. Many in particular believe that, by 2045, the point of Technological Singularity will occur. This means that, if AI is developed, without regulation, it could surpass human intelligence.

AI is useful at the present time, however, continuing to develop this, without limits, is dangerous. Machines will always make mistakes, let's not become inferior to them.

attributes.action: Make it an offense for essay writing services to advertise to under 16's
attributes.background: In the same way that gambling, alcohol and cigarettes are prohibited from advertising to minors, I suggest similar measures be applied to companies like UK Essays and other Essay Mills in order to protect minors from being unduly influenced by manipulative marketing practices.
attributes.additional_details:
UK Essays Website:
https://www.ukessays.com/services/essay-writing-service.php
Facebook Ad:
https://www.facebook.com/UKEssays/posts/10159836527715151
Twitter Ad:
https://twitter.com/UKEssays/status/970984231051636736

attributes.action: Start a British Foreign Legion.
attributes.background: Many British Army applicants are turned away due to their history of mental illness, certain complications such as having had a detached retina and also those with a criminal background. However The French Foreign legion could accept these failed applicants and they often prove to be great recruits.
attributes.additional_details:
So I ask that a British Foreign Legion is formed so Patriots of this country who were rejected by the British Army can serve their country, as I believe it is wrong that many patriots like my self are not given this opportunity, due to their pasts.
Just like the French Foreign legion, people who want to come to this country to make a better life for themselves could do so by serving five years in the British Foreign legion. After that time is served they can be granted British citizenship.

attributes.action: Set a minimum price per calorie for unhealthy foods
attributes.background: People have become accustomed to eating foods such as fast food, chocolate, sweets etc. These are unnecessarily high in calories and, as a result, directly fuel the obesity crisis. A minimum price per calorie would force these foods to be made with the same taste and far fewer calories.
attributes.additional_details:
Suggestion: 1p per calorie.  

E.g. In order to sell a typical fast food lunch of currently 1000 calories would cost a prohibitive £10.  In order to sell the same meal for £5, fast food chains would be forced to create the same, good tasting meal for only 500 calories.

attributes.action: Get Michael Gove to maintain farming subsidies after Brexit.
attributes.background: Under current EU legislation farmers in the UK receive 3 billion pounds year in subsidies mostly in basic payments which are based on per acre owned of land.
attributes.additional_details:
Michael Gove the environment secretary has pledged post Brexit to maintain the basic payments for most farmers for a transition period only. He is in the meantime reviewing several options to cap the payments and introduce progressive reductions.

The petition is to maintain the payments to the farmers.

British Farming employs 3.8 million people and is a business worth 109 billion. The idea of the petition is to educate the public about the value British farming has on the country and ask for their support by signing a petition to lobby their MP’s to support continuing subsidies for British farmers.

attributes.action: Let 15 year olds take their CBT once they reach their final school year
attributes.background: When you're 16, you can take your cbt, ride a motorcycle, buy energy drinks, and get a job, however a 15 year old in the same school year can’t do any of these things. How come you're mature enough to be in the same school year, but not to have any of the perks?
attributes.additional_details: I found it especially frustrating, having a birthday in August, I had to see teenagers, who were in the same school year and learning the same as me ride motorbikes, and get jobs, while I was stuck in a village with no transport, a friend of mine in the same school year had a motorbike and had no issue, for instance, I could have been doing motorvehicle as an apprenticeship, but not be able to get a licence until after someone who’s never driven before, even though their the same year

attributes.action: Hold a Northern Ireland referendum on whether to Remain in the EU Customs Union
attributes.background: Northern Ireland voted by a significant majority to Remain in the EU and will be one of the regions most significantly affected by withdrawal. As Sinn Fein do not take up their seats in Parliament, it would be good to go directly to the NI electorate for their views on this proposal.

attributes.action: Reduce preventable negligence cases within the NHS
attributes.background: Thousands of patients are being let down by avoidable errors made by the NHS. Errors such as failing to provide emergency care, mistakes in dispensing the correct drugs and dosages, misdiagnosis, delays in treatment, and incorrect treatment. This is harming patients and causing unnecessary deaths.
attributes.additional_details: Over the last decade, negligence claims against the NHS have quadrupled to an annual payout of £1.7 billion. This is set to double by 2021. This suggests a growing problem that isn't being dealt with effectively. Health leaders propose to address this issue by capping the amount of compensation that is paid out to victims. Yet this won't reduce the number of negligence cases. We need to invest more resources into identifying the root causes of the problem and in turn implementing a solution.

attributes.action: Ban nudity on social media
attributes.background: Nudity has a negative affect on society, and vulnerable individuals are pressured into posting provocative images online which will stay there forever. Naked pictures online causes harm to future generations, because children may feel ‘not good enough’ when compared to the images online.
attributes.additional_details: Instagram and YouTube are full of inappropriate material that shouldn’t be uploaded in the first place.

attributes.action: Stop change 4 life's campaign on healthy eating and lifestyle
attributes.background: Change 4 life's campaign for a healthy lifestyle is supposedly trying to help children. However, exposing nutritional values to children or such young ages can become a main cause of developing an eating disorder.
attributes.additional_details:
Children and young adolescents should be able to enjoy a carefree childhood without the pressure of obsessing over the things they eat. Everything in moderation is healthy and children should be encouraged to believe this. Eating disorders are on the rise but yet this campaign is still choosing to fuel them and ignore the high mortality rate
 as a result of these illness'.

attributes.action: Instate a Queens day in honour of Queen Elizabeth the 2nd.
attributes.background: The Queen is a staple of Britain, I and many others believe she should have a bank holiday dedicated to her Highness.

attributes.action: Start a Parliamentary debate over funding of the UK's crumbling road network
attributes.background: The UK is the 9th richest country in the world by GDP however a recent survey of the standard of its road network placed it 27th behind such countries as Namibia and Ecuador. The problems represent chronic under investment in crucial infrastructure.
attributes.additional_details:
Studies have shown patching up roads to be 10 times more expensive in the long run than resurfacing entire stretches.

Please sign this petition if you too have had enough and think it is time the funding of road maintenance was subject to a serious debate in Parliament in attempt to bring the road network of the UK to a standard where it is actually fit for purpose rather than the national embarrassment, safety hazard to road users and barrier to economic growth that it currently is.

attributes.action: Black Ancient History to be taught in schools. As a course, module, in all level
attributes.background: In school the only recollection of any study about Africa, was based upon African colonisation, and pro independence; this was fine, until I started to come across information about African Ancient History post university, by myself, with the help of the internet. I felt overwhelmed and shocked.
attributes.additional_details:
I did Politics and International Relations Degree.

Nevertheless missing African Ancient history is like missing a huge chunk of world history.

If the following is included in the educational system, it would be great. Information about.....

- Nubia



- Songhai

- Lost African Kings and Queens such  as: Nefertiti, Sheba, Hannibal

- Kemet

- Ashanti

- Moors (when blacks ruled Spain)

 -Benin Empire(1180-1897 CE) , Mali Empire (1235-1600 CE) , Ghana Empire (700-1240 CE)

+ more

attributes.action: Ban large boats from passing through swing bridges at peak times.
attributes.background:
1. EVERYONE who goes through that route will or probably will be late for work or their appointments
2. Emergency services get blocked from entry by the large amounts of traffic
3. Pollution - Every car passing the route will be sat in the same spot with the engine running for a good 20-30 minutes
attributes.additional_details:
Reasons why boats shouldn't be allowed to pass through swing bridges at peak times;
1. EVERYONE who goes through that route will or probably will be late for work or their appointments
2. Emergency services get blocked from entry by the large amounts of traffic. Dying? Tough - a boat needs to deliver a few boxes of car parts
3. Pollution - pretty much every car that is on its way home from work will be sat in the same spot with the engine running (unless it's stop start) for a good 20-30 minutes

attributes.action: Make PIP awards subject to a letter from a persons medical team only.
attributes.background: PIP awards are currently subject to an assessment with a healthcare representative. These people are unaware of the majority of medical conditions presented to them. I propose that a person applying for PIP, should be awarded this based on a report produced by their medical team looking after them.

attributes.action: Ban robotic trading of stocks, shares or financial derivatives
attributes.background: Robotic/algorithmic trading  of stocks, shares and financial derivatives are used by big corporates to steal money from retail investors.
attributes.additional_details: Big banks and institutions should not be allowed do use automatic trading which could cause flash crash in the markets eventually stealing money from weak hands of retail investors. Such trading should be banned. Markets would be less volatile and retail investors feel more secured to invest in such a situation.

attributes.action: Educate people on buying bikes, bike safety and bike security.
attributes.background: So many people go off to buy cheap bikes and they have faults very quickly.So they throw it away or repair and replace parts often, this can a have a negative impact on the environment and people will ride bikes less, increasing the negative impact on the environment.We should ride bikes a lot more.

attributes.action: Remove Foundation and Higher maths papers and make one whole paper for everyone.
attributes.background: As everyone knows, there is higher and foundation maths. Foundation is for those who aren't as able at Maths but sometimes people are wrongly placed there. Make one whole paper for everyone, you never know what people could achieve. It would be fair to everyone if we all do the higher paper.
attributes.additional_details: The highest grade you can get for Foundation maths is C and it's known that its much easier to get a C in higher. Most people in foundation maths could easily get a 8 or a 9 (A's). The paper should be equal.

attributes.action: Remove  the Commercial speed restrictions on vehicles such as duel use pickups,
attributes.background: Vehicles such as Dual Cab pickups are still subjected to commercial speed restrictions on certain roads due to their curb weight even thou they are someone’s personal vehicle and not used for commercial use, remove these restrictions for personal use vehicles,
attributes.additional_details: If your pickup exceeds a unladen weight of 2048 kilos it has speed restrictions on certain roads which is rubbish as most modern cars such as range rovers weight sometimes over 3 tonne, just because a vehicle is deemed commercial doesn’t mean it should be restricted, personal use commercial vehicles not being used for business shouldn’t be subjected to this law, as new pick ups have better safety equipment than when this law was written,

attributes.action: Demonstrate how more disabled people in the workforce has impacted productivity.
attributes.background: On the 6/12/17, whilst giving evidence to the commons Treasury Select committee, Phillip Hammond stated that "It is almost certainly the case that...very high levels of engagement in the workforce, for example of disabled people...may have had an impact on overall productivity measurements.
attributes.additional_details:
For a full transcript, follow the link

http://data.parliament.uk/writtenevidence/committeeevidence.svc/evidencedocument/treasury-committee/budget-autumn-2017/oral/75188.html

attributes.action: Make sure we get a Brexit Deal.
attributes.background: If Brexit didn't have a deal, it would be chaos for us. If we can't get a  deal, we're on our own, and we'll have to rely on other countries to give us power and maybe being the end of the UK altogether. So there must be a Brexit deal, or we're in anarchy.

attributes.action: Change the gcse scheme back to A,B,C instead of grades 9-1 so it’s easier
attributes.background: The students currently about to take GCSEs have been studying from year 7 up to get an A+ or etc all of a sudden the mark scheme has been changed which is not fair. The government have made it too hard for them to achieve in such small time.
attributes.additional_details: We need to make it easier so more students are able to be more successful in life. Changing the grading scheme has not made it only harder for children to be more successful but has also put more stress on them as the government had only changed it recently.

attributes.action: Reduce Foreign Aid budget to 0.5% of GDP
attributes.background: I propose we reduce the Foreign Aid budget to 0.5% of GDP then put those savings into NHS, Policing, Armed Forces, Schools & Infra-structure in equal proportions.
attributes.additional_details:
We currently put 0.7% of our GDP into Foreign Aid, which is ok when we can afford it but the needs of our Country must come first.
It is the duty of the Government to put the security of the nation first that means increasing the funding for our Armed Forces.
It is also the duty of our Government to ensure the safety of its people that means increasing the funding for our Police.
Until our Road networks are repaired, our Hospitals upgraded, our schools rebuilt and our Police and Armed Forces are fully equipped to defend our Nation the reduce Foreign Aid Budget should remain.
Once we have rebuilt these vital services we can once again increase our Foreign Aid budget on the understanding that it is fully audited and overseen by our Armed Forces, that way we can see how our money is spent

attributes.action: British Army only to be used overseas at the request of a Sovereign Government.
attributes.background: No more Invasions, No more innocents suffering for greed and power, No more fighting 'Rebels',trained,funded and supplied by our weapons and the weapons of our allies.
attributes.additional_details: History

attributes.action: Vehicle tax to include levy for repair of roads maintained by local authorities
attributes.background: The condition of local roads is poor.  Pot holes and bad repairs are a mounting problem that impact all road users.  The situation in places can be dangerous and cause significant costs.  A link to vehicle tax would be a link to the number of vehicles and thus provide proportionate funds.
attributes.additional_details: Evidence can be found in the budget of local authorities.  Requirements exceed funding, over many years, by large amounts.

attributes.action: Set out a date for the introduction of care home fees cap.
attributes.background: The Government has been making false promises to put a limit on care home fees since 2011. Last election, the Government promised in its lying manifesto to introduce a cap.
attributes.additional_details: People like me and my family that have worked hard bought our own homes and have been  "prudent with our money," have not been "rewarded" as the Government promised.

attributes.action: Amend the Town and Country Planning Regulations on the flying of the EU flag
attributes.background: Under the 2007/2012 Planning Regulations flags can be flown without consent. Schedule 1 Class H allows: The flag of the Commonwealth, EU, UN, or any other international organisation of which the UK is a member. On 29/3/2019 the UK will leave the EU, hence flying the EU flag without consent must end.
attributes.additional_details:
The Town and Country Planning Regulations 2007 and amendment 2012, allows certain flags can be flown without consent, as set out within Schedule 1, Class H. 
One of these flags, the EU flag,  can be flown because it is a flag of an international organisation of which the UK is a member. From 29th March 2019 this will no longer be the case. Therefore, in future consent must be required.
The government’s guidance in “Flying flags: a plain English guide” must also be updated to reflect this change.

attributes.action: Raise the legal age to 25 for buying knives or blades of any type.
attributes.background: Children as young as 14 are carrying & using knives to harm others.The current age of 18 yrs is clearly not enough. Not everyone will adhere to a knife amnesty, nor will stop and search reach all.Raise the legal age to 25.Make it harder for them to obtain in the first place so less knives on streets

attributes.action: Companies to accept all holiday requests from families during school holidays.
attributes.background: For those being told that they can’t have a certain week off and then left to find AND PAY for childcare because their existing provider is closed! Leaving them to give their child to a stranger which is expensive and potentially puts them at risk. All requests to be accepted even if they overlap
attributes.additional_details: I propose we make it legal that if you have 1 or more children under 16 and you request a week off during the school holidays to cover childcare, your company cannot refuse. Currently each company have their own rules around staffing, 1 person off at a time for example. Meaning you need to find a stranger to watch your child and pay for the risky privilege. Companies refuse to pay for cover for that week and we lose out. It helps families financially in a big big way and also stops worry.

attributes.action: Make up-skirt photography an illegal offence in the UK
attributes.background: Upskirting is the act of taking a photograph of underneath a person's skirt without their consent. It is often performed in a public place such as on public transport or on an escalator. Many women across the UK are targeted in places such as nightclubs, restaurants and shops. This needs to stop.
attributes.additional_details: In Scotland, Upskirting is an illegal offence, and has been since 2010. Victims and police are only able to pursue offences of voyeurism and indecency, with a Freedom of Information request made by the Press Association revealing that the police have pursued 78 offences related to upskirting since 2015 - but only 11 led to alleged offenders being charged.

attributes.action: Abolish school uniform in all schools.
attributes.background: School uniform rules have recently become too strict, to the point where people are being suspended from school for their appearance. We preach about not missing education yet we stop it over cloth and dye? Teenagers should express themselves and not be punished for being unique.
attributes.additional_details: When a student has done something particularly bad like get into a fight or bully another student we suspend them or put them in isolation to punish the student. Why is a student with blue hair or with a t-shirt being punished at the same level? We encourage students to 'be themselves' yet we confine this with rules. Teenagers already struggle in schools with exams, hormones, sexuality etc. We shouldn't be giving them more reasons to stress out. Casual dress-code doesn't stop them learning.

attributes.action: Allow fast food delivery drivers access to bus lanes during operating hours.
attributes.background: As the majority of bus lanes restrict public traffic from travelling along them between 7am-7pm, a lot of fast food takeaways deliver within these hours and delivery drivers are commonly stuck in traffic during rush hour. This results in orders arriving late, negative customer reviews etc.
attributes.additional_details: A simple suggestion to put this into perspective would be to allow employers to distribute e.g. Plates, stickers to their employees vehicles to easily identify that they are eligible and to also prevent the misuse of bus lanes.
